order

Class Order

  • java.lang.Object
    • order.Order
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    OrderRow, OrderView

    public class Order
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Order Entity holds all the information for the order table
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Order

        public Order(int id,
             Order.Status status,
             float price,
             java.util.Calendar orderCreationDateTime,
             java.time.LocalDate date,
             java.lang.String time,
             java.lang.String deliveryAddress,
             java.lang.String receiverName,
             java.lang.String receiverPhoneNumber,
             Order.PayMethod payMethod,
             long originShop,
             long customerID)
      throws OrderException
        Creates a new Order with the following parameters
        Parameters:
        id - the order ID
        status - the Order status
        price - the order total price
        orderCreationDateTime - the Order creation date and time
        date - the order required date
        time - the order required time
        deliveryAddress - the order delivery address
        receiverName - The order receiver Name
        receiverPhoneNumber - The order receiver phone number
        payMethod - the way the order was paid for {CASH, CREDITCARD, SUBSCRIPTION}
        originShop - the order origin shop ID
        customerID - the customer ID who created the order
        Throws:
        OrderException - thrown if invalid parameters were given
